relation: Great for these types of students
I'm an online student. I don't know about campus safety.
The online degree program is good for adult students with full-time jobs or other obligations that make keeping a regular class schedule difficult.
I think it's a very good education for the money.
I'm an online student. I don't know about dining.
I'm an online student. I don't know about dorm life.
I believe online students have to dig deeper and do more research to earn grades.
Do your research. Know your learning style. If you're not a big reader, and you prefer to have someone walk you through every step of your assignments an online degree may not be for you.
Baker Online is convenient for adult students. The tuition costs is fair. Baker allowed me to transfer credits from a Nationally Certified College.
pageTitle: Baker College of Flint Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {114452=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 67464=The books and school supplies in the campus store are over priced and a waist of money, unless it's for the books Baker has specially made. The staff is helpful and usually makes up for it though. For a private school the tuition is great, for school year 2012-2013 it was 2 dollars cheaper than the local community college. I have never had a teacher I couldn't get along with, and some of the staff are really excellent. Sadly the staff in the Financial aid office and few in the Academic office need better training or something, sometimes a student can spend half a day bouncing between offices and accomplish nothing more than getting dizzy. You are usually better off talking to the head of your program, they are usually wonderful academic advisors who will move mountains for you. Don't be afraid to ask them for help!}

Reviewer has been to campus. 5 out of 5 people found this review useful. 1 of 32 Margrett from Flint, MI Check out reviews left by other students or leave your own review.
